name: Bio2RDF
body:
# Bio2RDF
Bio2RDF provides access to biological, chemical, and other scientific databases using semantic web technologies to provide common references for linked life science data.

## RDF conversion scripts
The Bio2RDF community has created [scripts to convert scientific databases to RDF](https://github.com/bio2rdf/bio2rdf-scripts). These conversions scripts utilise the common Bio2RDF URIs to link between data items within and across databases.

## Vocabulary mappings
The Bio2RDF community has created [vocabularies](https://github.com/bio2rdf/bio2rdf-mappings) to standardise properties that are used in the RDF conversions process.

## SPARQL endpoints
The Bio2RDF community provides a number of publicly available copies of the databases that are generated by the RDF conversion scripts. These are available as [SPARQL endpoints](http://download.bio2rdf.org/release/2/release.html) using the Virtuoso Open Source database.

## Web application
The Bio2RDF.org website is powered by the [QueryAll Linked Data Server](https://github.com/ansell/queryall). The configuration and template files used by Bio2RDF are available [here](https://github.com/bio2rdf/bio2rdf-webapp).

## Authors and Contributors
Bio2RDF was created by Fran√ßois Belleau (@fbelleau) and Marc Alexandre Nolin. The scripts and databases are maintained by Michel Dumontier (@micheldumontier), Alison Callahan (@alisoncallahan), Jose Cruz-Toledo (@jctoledo) and Dana Klassen (@dklassen). Peter Ansell (@ansell) maintains the Web Application. 

### Support or Contact
The [Bio2RDF Mailing List](https://groups.google.com/group/bio2rdf) provides an easy way to discuss issues with the Bio2RDF community.
